newsitem.title: JAPAN: SOCCER-JAPAN STAY ON COURSE FOR WORLD CUP FINALS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JAPAN STAY ON COURSE FOR WORLD CUP FINALS.

text.p: Japan moved a step closer to a first appearance in the World Cup finals when a 1-1 draw with Oman on Saturday clinched a place in the last round of the Asian zone qualifying tournament.
Japan took an early lead through a first half header by Hidetoshi Nakata but Oman substitute Maidi Fatah Samir levelled in the 64th minute.
The Japanese headed Asian qualifying group four with 16 points from six games and now qualify for the 10-nation final round to be staged in late October and early November.
The top three finishers go to France, while the fourth-placed team play off against the Oceania zone winner for a place in the finals.
